text: ਸਵਈਏ ਮਹਲੇ ਦੂਜੇ ਕੇ ੨

translation.text: Swaiyas In Praise Of The Second Mehl:

transliteration.text: savaīē mahalē dūjē kē 2

text: ੴ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਪ੍ਰਸਾਦਿ ॥

translation.text: One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru:

transliteration.text: ik ōunkār satigur prasād .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

text: ਸੋਈ ਪੁਰਖੁ ਧੰਨੁ ਕਰਤਾ ਕਾਰਣ ਕਰਤਾਰੁ ਕਰਣ ਸਮਰਥੋ ॥

translation.text: Blessed is the Primal Lord God, the Creator, the All-powerful Cause of causes.

transliteration.text: sōī purakh dhann karatā kāran karatār karan samarathō .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: Poet Kalshar
author.description:
Poet Kalshar [15th - 16th Century] was part of a group of eleven poets and singers known as Bhatts, who were all Vaishnavites, followers of Lord Rama and Lord Krishna, who had come to the congregation of Guru Arjan Dev, the fifth Sikh Guru, seeking spiritual solace.

Kalshar, who is also known as Kalh and Talh, was the leader of the poets, and taking into consideration the total contribution of hymns by the poets which is 123, Poet Kalshar alone has contributed a considerable 54 hymns.

Poet Kalshar wrote ten hymns in praise of Guru Nanak Dev, ten in praise of Guru Angad Dev, nine in praise of Guru Amar Das, thirteen in praise of Guru Ram Das and twelve in praise of Guru Arjan Dev. Also, he was the son of Chokha, and brother of Poet Gayand.

text: ਸਤਿਗੁਰੂ ਧੰਨੁ ਨਾਨਕੁ ਮਸਤਕਿ ਤੁਮ ਧਰਿਓ ਜਿਨਿ ਹਥੋ ॥

translation.text: Blessed is the True Guru Nanak, who placed His hand upon Your forehead.

transliteration.text: satigurū dhann nānak masatak tum dhariō jin hathō .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

translation.text: When He placed His hand upon Your forehead, then the celestial nectar began to rain down in torrents; the gods and human beings, heavenly heralds and sages were drenched in its fragrance.

transliteration.text: t dhariō masatak hath sahaj amiu vuthau shaj sur nar gan mun bōhiy agāj .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

translation.text: You challenged and subdued the cruel demon of death; You restrained Your wandering mind; You overpowered the five demons and You keep them in one home.

transliteration.text: māriō kantak kāl garaj dhāvat līō baraj panch bhūt ēk ghar rākh lē samaj .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

translation.text: Through the Guru's Door, the Gurdwara, You have conquered the world; You play the game even-handedly. You keep the flow of your love steady for the Formless Lord.

transliteration.text: jag jītau gur duār khēlah samat sār rath unaman liv rākh nirankār .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

translation.text: O Kal Sahaar, chant the Praises of Lehnaa throughout the seven continents; He met with the Lord, and became Guru of the World. ||1||

transliteration.text: kah kīrat kal sahār sapat dīp majhār lahanā jagatr gur paras murār .1.

translation.text: The Stream of Ambrosial Nectar from His eyes washes away the slime and filth of sins; the sight of His door dispels the darkness of ignorance.

transliteration.text: jā kī drisat anmrit dhār kālukh khan utār timar agyān jāh daras duār .

translation.text: Whoever accomplishes this most difficult task of contemplating the most sublime Word of the Shabad - those people cross over the terrifying world-ocean, and cast off their loads of sin.

transliteration.text: ōi j sēvah sabad sār gākharī bikham kār tē nar bhav utār kīē nirabhār .

translation.text: The Sat Sangat, the True Congregation, is celestial and sublime; whoever remains awake and aware, contemplating the Guru, embodies humility, and is imbued forever with the Supreme Love of the Lord.

transliteration.text: satasangat sahaj sār jāgīlē gur bīchār ninmarī bhūt sadīv param piār .

translation.text: You hold tight to the Naam, the Name of the Infinite Lord; Your expanse is immaculate. You are the Support of the Siddhas and seekers, and the good and humble beings.

transliteration.text: tai tau dririō nām apār bimal jās bithār sādhik sidh sujan jīā kō adhār .

translation.text: You are the incarnation of King Janak; the contemplation of Your Shabad is sublime throughout the universe. You abide in the world like the lotus on the water.

transliteration.text: tū tā janik rājā autār sabad sansār sār rahah jagatr jal padam bīchār .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

translation.text: Like the Elyisan Tree, You cure all illnesses and take away the sufferings of the world. The three-phased soul is lovingly attuned to You alone.

transliteration.text: kalip tar rōg bidār sansār tāp nivār ātamā tribidh tērai ēk liv tār .

translation.text: You were blessed with glory by the Prophet; You serve the Guru, certified by the Lord, who has subdued the snake of the mind, and who abides in the state of sublime bliss.

transliteration.text: tai tā hadarath pāiō mān sēviā gur paravān sādh ajagar jin kīā unamān .

translation.text: Your Vision is like that of the Lord, Your soul is a fount of spiritual wisdom; You know the unfathomable state of the certified Guru.

transliteration.text: har har daras samān ātamā vantagiān jānī akal gat gur paravān .

translation.text: Your Gaze is focused upon the unmoving, unchanging place. Your Intellect is immaculate; it is focused upon the most sublime place. Wearing the armor of humility, you have overcome Maya.

transliteration.text: jā kī drisat achal thān bimal budh suthān pahir sīl sanāh sakat bidār .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

Kalshar, who is also known as Kalh and Talh, was the leader of the poets, and taking into consideration the total contribution of hymns by the poets which is 123, Poet Kalshar alone has contributed a considerable 54 hymns.

Poet Kalshar wrote ten hymns in praise of Guru Nanak Dev, ten in praise of Guru Angad Dev, nine in praise of Guru Amar Das, thirteen in praise of Guru Ram Das and twelve in praise of Guru Arjan Dev. Also, he was the son of Chokha, and brother of Poet Gayand.

text: ਕਹੁ ਕੀਰਤਿ ਕਲ ਸਹਾਰ ਸਪਤ ਦੀਪ ਮਝਾਰ ਲਹਣਾ ਜਗਤ੍ਰ ਗੁਰੁ ਪਰਸਿ ਮੁਰਾਰਿ ॥੪॥

translation.text: O Kal Sakaar, chant the Praises of Lehnaa throughout the seven continents; He met with the Lord, and became Guru of the World. ||4||

transliteration.text: kah kīrat kal sahār sapat dīp majhār lahanā jagatr gur paras murār .4.

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

translation.text: Casting Your Glance of Grace, you dispel the darkness, burn away evil, and destroy sin.

transliteration.text: drisat dharat tam haran dahan agh pāp pranāsan .

translation.text: You are the Heroic Warrior of the Shabad, the Word of God. Your Power destroys sexual desire and anger.

translation.text: You are appointed the True Guru, the True Guru in this Dark Age of Kali Yuga; whoever is truly attached to You is carried across.

transliteration.text: satigurū kal satigur tilak sat lāgai sō pai tarai .

translation.text: The lion, the son of Pheru, is Guru Angad, the Guru of the World; Lehnaa practices Raja Yoga, the Yoga of meditation and success. ||5||

transliteration.text: gur jagat phiranasīh angarau rāj jōg lahanā karai .5.

translation.text: Your mind remains lovingly attuned to the Lord forever; You do whatever you desire.

text: ਨਾਮੁ ਅਵਖਧੁ ਨਾਮੁ ਆਧਾਰੁ ਅਰੁ ਨਾਮੁ ਸਮਾਧਿ ਸੁਖੁ ਸਦਾ ਨਾਮ ਨੀਸਾਣੁ ਸੋਹੈ ॥

translation.text: The Naam, the Name of the Lord, is our medicine; the Naam is our support; the Naam is the peace of Samaadhi. The Naam is the insignia which embellishes us forever.

transliteration.text: nām avakhadh nām ādhār ar nām samādh sukh sadā nām nīsān sōhai .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: Poet Kalshar
author.description:
Poet Kalshar [15th - 16th Century] was part of a group of eleven poets and singers known as Bhatts, who were all Vaishnavites, followers of Lord Rama and Lord Krishna, who had come to the congregation of Guru Arjan Dev, the fifth Sikh Guru, seeking spiritual solace.

Kalshar, who is also known as Kalh and Talh, was the leader of the poets, and taking into consideration the total contribution of hymns by the poets which is 123, Poet Kalshar alone has contributed a considerable 54 hymns.

Poet Kalshar wrote ten hymns in praise of Guru Nanak Dev, ten in praise of Guru Angad Dev, nine in praise of Guru Amar Das, thirteen in praise of Guru Ram Das and twelve in praise of Guru Arjan Dev. Also, he was the son of Chokha, and brother of Poet Gayand.

text: ਰੰਗਿ ਰਤੌ ਨਾਮ ਸਿਉ ਕਲ ਨਾਮੁ ਸੁਰਿ ਨਰਹ ਬੋਹੈ ॥

translation.text: KAL is imbued with the Love of the Naam, the Naam which is the fragrance of gods and human beings.

transliteration.text: rang ratau nām siu kal nām sur narah bōhai .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

text: ਨਾਮ ਪਰਸੁ ਜਿਨਿ ਪਾਇਓ ਸਤੁ ਪ੍ਰਗਟਿਓ ਰਵਿ ਲੋਇ ॥

translation.text: Whoever obtains the Naam, the Philosopher's Stone, becomes the embodiment of Truth, manifest and radiant throughout the world.

transliteration.text: nām paras jin pāiō sat pragatiō rav lōi .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

text: ਦਰਸਨਿ ਪਰਸਿਐ ਗੁਰੂ ਕੈ ਅਠਸਠਿ ਮਜਨੁ ਹੋਇ ॥੮॥

translation.text: Gazing upon the Blessed Vision of the Guru's Darshan, it is as if one has bathed at the sixty-eight sacred shrines of pilgrimage. ||8||

transliteration.text: darasan parasiai gurū kai athasath majan hōi .8.

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

translation.text: The True Name is the sacred shrine, the True Name is the cleansing bath of purification and food. The True Name is eternal love; chant the True Name, and be embellished.

transliteration.text: sach tīrath sach isanān ar bhōjan bhāu sach sadā sach bhākhant sōhai .

translation.text: The True Name is obtained through the Word of the Guru's Shabad; the Sangat, the Holy Congregation, is fragrant with the True Name.

transliteration.text: sach pāiō gur sabad sach nām sangatī bōhai .

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

translation.text: KAL the poet utters the Praises of the one whose self-discipline is the True Name, and whose fast is the True Name.

transliteration.text: jis sach sanjam varat sach kab jan kal vakhān .

translation.text: Gazing upon the Blessed Vision of the Guru's Darshan, one's life is approved and certified in the True Name. ||9||

transliteration.text: darasan parasiai gurū kai sach janam paravān .9.

translation.text: When You bestow Your Ambrosial Glance of Grace, You eradicate all wickedness, sin and filth.

translation.text: Sexual desire, anger, greed and emotional attachment - You have overcome all these powerful passions.

translation.text: Your mind is filled with peace forever; You banish the sufferings of the world.

translation.text: The Guru is the river of the nine treasures, washing off the dirt of our lives.

transliteration.text: gur nav nidh darīāu janam ham kālakh dhōvai .

translation.text: So speaks TAL the poet: serve the Guru, day and night, with intuitive love and affection.

translation.text: Gazing upon the Blessed Vision of the Guru, the pains of death and rebirth are taken away. ||10||

transliteration.text: darasan parasiai gurū kai janam maran dukh jāi .10.
